Gainsborough Community Library

Manager: Mandy Grimwood

Clapgate Lane, Ipswich
IP3 0RL

  • Tel: 01473 927270
  • Email: help@suffolklibraries.co.uk
  • Friends group: Voices for Gainsborough Community Library
  • Facebook

Branch updates

  • Gainsborough Community Library is looking for Summer Reading Challenge volunteers.
  • Gainsborough Community Library and Ipswich Community Media are looking for two young volunteers aged 16+ to help run a radio project. This opportunity is for 2.5 hours a week and includes 10 weeks' free training. Contact the library for more information.

Opening hours

Day Hours
Monday 0900 – 1800
Tuesday 0900 – 1700
Wednesday 0900 – 1700
Thursday 0900 – 1700
Friday 0900 – 1800
Saturday 0900 – 1700
Sunday 1100 – 1600

Room & venue hire

Room and space hire at Gainsborough Community Library →

Branch facilities

  • Accessibility information
  • Payments: cash, cheques and cards accepted
  • Parking: small car park available at rear of library
  • Out-of-hours book return available
  • Customer toilet
  • Free sanitary products available
  • Refreshments: available in our café
  • Display space: two cork boards in cafe area for A3, A4 or A5 posters
  • Which? available - ask staff for magazine or to log in
  • Also available:
    • Move It sports equipment available to borrow
    • Literacy and learning games available to borrow

IT and printing facilities

  • Free wifi
  • Book a computer
  • Borrow an eReader
  • Photocopying: black and white, A4 or A3 available
  • Colour printing: A4 or smaller available
  • Scan to email
  • Printing, photocopying & scanning charges

Regular events and activities

Children's events

4YP Fridays: for years 7-9

Friday, 1600-1800

Activities, games and more. Free but limited spaces, so first come, first served. Email keyara.abdul@syphp.org.uk for more information.

Art session for 11+ year-olds: term-time only

Wednesday, 1700-1830

Bookstart singing and stay and play

Friday, 1000-1100

Find out more about our Bookstart sessions

Boxing and Fitness: for 8-11 year-olds

every other Tuesday from 25 June 2019, 1600-1700

Contact the library for more details and to book. Priority given to children from the IP3 area.

Boys' group: for ages 12-16

Friday, 1600-1700

Boys' group: for ages 8-11

Tuesday, 1530-1645

Children's activities

Saturday, 1300-1600

Programme includes health cooking, science fun and fitness fun. Contact the library for more information.

Craft activities: for primary school age children

Sunday, 1300-1500

HIIT and boxing fitness with Suffolk Sport: for 14-19 year-olds

Wednesdays, 1700-1745

Free fitness satellite club

Girls' group: have fun and build your self-esteem

Monday, 1600-1700

  • 15 July: Movie night
  • 22 July: Outing - location tbc

Lego Animation Club

Monday, 1500-1745

Little Story Makers: for pre-school children and their parents and carers

Tuesday, 1030-1130

In association with the Tree House Children's Centre. Tree House garden available to use after the session. Term-time only.

Hama-beads

Wednesday, 1545-1645 (1430-1645 during summer holidays)

Stay & Play

Monday, 0930-1130

Social time for parents and small children. Toys and colouring, plus story and rhyme time from 11-11:30am.

Street Dance with Just Jay: for children aged 8+

Thurday, 1600-1700

£1 a session, term-time only.

Summer Reading Challenge

Summer Reading Challenge

every day from 20 July, opening hours

Sign up, talk to a volunteer about your latest read, borrow your next book and collect rewards.

Older people's events

Top Time: events and activities for older people

Monday, 1400-1600

  • 15 July: RSPCA talk
  • 22 July: Chair-based yoga
  • 29 July: Bring & buy sale
  • 5 August: Utility Warehouse talk
  • 12 August: Mayor & civic regalia talk
  • 19 August: Healthwatch talk
  • 2 September: Bus trip to Bury
  • 9 September: Chair-based dancing
  • 16 September: Lunch in the library café
  • 23 September: Mind talk
  • 30 September: WI talk

Time 4 You: all welcome

first Tuesday of the month, 1700-1815

Relax, unwind and socialise while listening to a talk or having a chat. Free tea, coffee and cake. Hosted by members of the Methodist Church.
